text: George W. Rayfield is a physicist from the University of Oregon. Dr. Rayfield was awarded the status of Fellow in the American Physical Society, after they were nominated by their Division of Biological Physics in 1995, for definitive experimental proof for quantized vortex rings in superfluid helium; for high precision studies on phase transitions in monolayers; for extensive studies on the optical and electrical properties of bacteriorhodopsin, and ensuing device applications. == References == Category:Fellows of the American Physical Society Category:American physicists Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: George W. Rayfield
